goal.core.runtime.service.environment

Class EnvironmentService

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.core.runtime.service.environment.EnvironmentService

  • public class EnvironmentService
extends java.lang.Object
    Launches the environment in the MAS and maintains a registry of other environments in the system. This can either be a remote environment or a local environment started by this environment service.

    The connection is provided in the form of a EnvironmentPort that can be used as an interface for a the environment. The environment service creates an environment port for every environment that is known to the messaging service when the environment service is started.

    FIXME: It is currently not possible to create environment ports for environments that are created after the environment service starts.

    Author:
    K.Hindriks, M.P. Korstanje

      • start

        public void start()
           throws GOALLaunchFailureException,
                  eis.exceptions.EnvironmentInterfaceException,
                  java.lang.InterruptedException,
                  nl.tudelft.goal.messaging.exceptions.MessagingException
        Starts the environment service. Depending on the mas program this may create and initialize a local environment. For all available environments a EnvironmentPort is created.
        Throws:
        GOALLaunchFailureException
        eis.exceptions.EnvironmentInterfaceException
